title: EastEnders spoilers: Stuart devastated as Rainie is arrested after brutally attacking Kathy
text:
Rainie Branning (Tanya Franks) has been struggling to cope with her addiction to drugs in EastEnders, but her actions spiralled out of control in tonight’s episode, as she sought revenge on Kathy Beale (Gillian Taylforth) for the part she played in getting her addicted again in the first place.

Kathy grew concerned about Rainie being left in charge of Abi during last week’s episodes, and thus she discussed her drug habit with Max (Jake Wood), who wasted little time in making it clear that — as long as Rainie’s addicted to drugs — she will continue to put drugs above everything else.

Determined to find out if there was any truth in what Max had to say, she came up with an idea, and thus removed a packet of drugs from her bag and left them on the table nearby Rainie — prompting her to make a choice between the drugs or Abi.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Stuart (Ricky Champ) was livid when he got wind of what Kathy had done, and thus he threatened to stop her from seeing Abi. Meanwhile, Rainie — determined to prove herself to Kathy — deposited the drugs down the kitchen sink in front of the Beale matriarch. However, unbeknown to both Kathy and Stuart, Rainie hadn’t gotten rid of all of the drugs — as she decided to keep some for herself.

Tonight, Kathy was regretful over what she did and — determined to prevent anyone else from finding out — she agreed to allow Rainie to take Abi to the park unsupervised.

Meanwhile, with Rainie behaving odd, Stuart questioned whether or not he truly trusted her, and thus he opened up to Bex (Jasmine Armfield) about his fears. However, Bex simply insisted that he give Rainie the benefit of the doubt — and he ultimately agreed to do so.

With a happier outlook, Stuart set off to find Rainie, but — upon locating her — he was left devastated when he found her, as she was about to take drugs while in charge of baby Abi.

Stuart berated her, and threw her drugs into the nearby grass — leaving Rainie incredibly upset. Afterwards, Stuart prompted her to make a choice between Abi and the drugs but Rainie seemingly chose the drugs, as she got down on her hands and knees and searched for them.

Later, a muddied Rainy got into a verbal altercation with Martin (James Bye), but Martin proceeded to tell her to sort herself out. Upon reflection, that’s exactly what Rainie set about doing.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Afterwards, Rainie paid Kathy a visit and proceeded to blame her for everything that’s transpired, before confirming what Max said by reiterating that drugs will come before anything and anyone when you’re an addict.

The police arrived on Kathy’s doorstep, and Kathy was incredibly confused as a result, as they informed her they were here to follow up after receiving a report of an assault. Rainie didn’t seem perturbed by their arrival, and it came to light that she knew exactly why they were there. Before long, she brutally attacked Kathy, which led to her getting arrested.

Upon hearing an irate Rainie kicking and screaming as the police officers dragged her out of the Beale household, Stuart headed over to see what was going on — but Rainie made it clear that she was intent on getting herself sorted out, before telling him that she loves him, and that he’d be better off if he let her go.

Is this the end for Stuart and Rainie?

What’s more, have we seen the last of Rainie?

EastEnders continues on Thursday 17th October at 8pm on BBC One.
